user_voice_extracts.full_text: i want a simple flutter program that let's me on first initialization select a time frame year and month to year and month - july 2020 to june 2023 for instance and to estimate the total number of the islamic prayers I missed during that time frame. I can stay high level and say I missed 50% of all of them or i can go into each one fajir thuhur asr maghrib and isha and say how much I think i missed for that whole time frame. then the home page has a screen with a bar at the top representing total needed to be prayed and total prayed so far and then has five buttons for each prayer. when you click on that button it should fill in the farthest back prayer in the record and slowly fill up a progress bar representing that prayer. you should be able to edit details and get into each year, each month and go down to each prayer and modify the percentage prayed after the initialization screen, otherwise it should mostly focus on the home screen and counting up prayers. the prayers need to be saved on the phone so when you close/open it is preserved, you should be able to "restart" and go to the initialization process again. Think of the data model and the clearest easiest way to do this and help me write a flutter program that's easy to use
key_requirements: Estimation of missed prayers (broad 50% or granular per prayer type)
Home screen with progress bar (total needed vs total prayed)
Five prayer buttons (Fajr, Dhuhr, Asr, Maghrib, Isha)
Fill farthest-back prayer first with progress visualization
Edit details screen with year/month/prayer granularity
user_voice_extracts.intent: Define complete app architecture and request initial implementation

user_voice_extracts.snippet: lib/providers/prayer_provider.dart:31:11: Error: 'birthYear' is already declared in this scope... [10 compilation errors]
user_voice_extracts.intent: Request debugging and bug fixes for initial implementation

user_voice_extracts.snippet: Ok, all the values are null and pressing "pray" does nothing. and when i go into the edit details screen it completely crashes when i click year and then go to the month - rethink the edit details screen and ensure that the prayers are properly loaded from the hive...
issues_identified: Edit details screen crashes on year selection
Data not properly loading from Hive storage
Life expectancy graph taking up too much space
user_voice_extracts.user_request: Rethink the edit details screen and ensure proper data loading and initialization flow
user_voice_extracts.intent: Identify architectural issues and request system redesign

user_voice_extracts.snippet: LateInitializationError: Field '_data@495084504' has not been initialized... Also, the initial bar should be at 50 percent completed and the total prayers prayed should indicate that they've prayed 50% if they started with 50%
issues: Progress bar not reflecting initial percentages
Edit granularity only to year, not month
feature_requests: Initial progress bar at 50% if user specifies 50% missed
Month-level editing in addition to year-level
Broad initialization followed by granular editing
user_voice_extracts.intent: Report runtime exceptions and request specific UI/UX features

user_voice_extracts.snippet: Also, we don't need to set it automatically to 50% we are already taking that in in the initialization screen
clarifications_provided: Don't auto-set to 50%, use initialized percentages
Month selection dropdown has type mismatch
user_voice_extracts.intent: Clarify business logic and report type casting errors

user_voice_extracts.full_text: Let's add the ability to "restart" from the home screen to go back to the initialization page, and the nice bismillah on the top of the app, and replace Prayer Tracker with "Amana Prayer Tracker" and For each of the prayers - they should have their own tracker bar.
user_voice_extracts.intent: Add Islamic branding and improve prayer tracking granularity

user_voice_extracts.full_text: there is an ascii bismillah that you can use instead of images - we also have this hadith modal we can use
user_voice_extracts.intent: Point to existing components for reuse

quotable_quotes.quote: i want a simple flutter program that let's me on first initialization select a time frame year and month to year and month - july 2020 to june 2023 for instance and to estimate the total number of the islamic prayers I missed during that time frame.

quotable_quotes.quote: Think of the data model and the clearest easiest way to do this and help me write a flutter program that's easy to use

quotable_quotes.significance: Shows user is hands-on tester; notices functional gaps immediately

quotable_quotes.significance: User willing to challenge suggested features that don't serve purpose

quotable_quotes.significance: Shows understanding of progressive disclosure and granular control

islamic_prayer_tracker_amana.description: Flutter mobile app for tracking Islamic prayers across time periods with granular editing and progress visualization
key_features: Five prayer type buttons (Fajr, Dhuhr, Asr, Maghrib, Isha)
Edit details screen with month granularity

thinking_style.tools_preference: Visual feedback (seeing app run) drives thinking

decision_making_patterns.revision_willingness: High - willing to rethink entire components if needed

observed_learning: Gaining appreciation for progressive disclosure in UI
learning_trajectory.learning_style: Hands-on, failure-driven; learns what doesn't work quickly

blindspots: May underestimate complexity of initial architecture (null handling, data flow)
Sometimes requests quick fixes without considering full system redesign needs
Architecture iteration happens mid-project rather than upfront planning
strengths: Excellent at identifying what's broken (good tester)
Willing to iterate indefinitely without frustration
Connects technical work to deeper purpose (spiritual accountability)
implicit_beliefs: Technology should serve spiritual practice, not complicate it
Simple solutions are better than complex ones
User feedback (testing) is primary source of truth
Iterative improvement beats perfect initial design

patterns.description: User builds feature, encounters error, reports with full context, receives fix, tests immediately
patterns.significance: Primary mode of development; enables fast feedback loops

patterns.pattern: Feature requests emerge from testing feedback
patterns.description: Issues discovered during testing lead to feature refinements (progress bars, individual prayer tracking, restart button)
patterns.significance: Shows user drives feature prioritization through actual usage

patterns.pattern: Attention to code organization and naming
patterns.description: References file paths, method names, widget hierarchies; expects organized code structure
patterns.significance: Suggests organized thinking and preference for maintainability

patterns.description: Challenges features that don't serve clear purpose (life expectancy graph, auto 50% default)
patterns.significance: Demonstrates critical thinking about feature necessity

patterns.description: Despite multiple technical issues, user persists due to spiritual purpose of app
patterns.significance: Purpose alignment drives persistence through frustration

key_decisions.rationale: Personal spiritual accountability for missed prayers over time period
key_decisions.implications: Long-term personal use case; accuracy and trust matter

key_decisions.decision: Start with 'broad strokes' initialization, then granular editing
key_decisions.rationale: Balance between ease of setup and detailed control
key_decisions.implications: Two-phase user flow; initial estimated entry, then refinement

key_decisions.decision: Individual prayer tracker bars instead of combined progress
key_decisions.rationale: Each prayer type has different importance/tracking needs
key_decisions.implications: UI shows separate progress for Fajr, Dhuhr, Asr, Maghrib, Isha

key_decisions.decision: Use ASCII bismillah instead of image assets

key_decisions.rationale: Personal accountability tool; privacy and offline capability
key_decisions.implications: No backend dependency; data stays on device

key_decisions.rationale: Allow reinitializing if time period or estimates change
key_decisions.implications: User has full control over data; can restart fresh

summary.overall_theme: Building a spiritually-motivated personal accountability app through iterative development and hands-on testing
summary.primary_focus: Flutter mobile app development with focus on user experience and data persistence
summary.user_role: Technical product owner and hands-on tester
summary.key_insight: User's spiritual motivation (Islamic prayer tracking) sustains engagement through technical challenges; practical orientation toward simplicity drives feature prioritization
summary.technical_maturity: Intermediate Flutter developer with good debugging skills
summary.project_momentum: Steady progress despite bug encounters; strong completion intent
